member.name: T:Rebex.Security.Cryptography.CryptMD5Cram
member.summary: Implementation of CRAM-MD5 function according to RFC 2195 and 2104.

member.name: T:Rebex.Security.Cryptography.CryptMD5Digest
member.summary:
Cryptography algorithm for DIGEST-MD5 cryptography.
RFC 1321, RFC 2831

member.name: F:Rebex.Security.Cryptography.CryptMD5Digest._digestChallenge
member.summary:
Description of digest algorithm:
digest-challenge = 1#( realm | nonce | qop-options | stale | maxbuf | charset algorithm | cipher-opts | auth-param ) realm = "realm" "=" " realm-value " realm-value = qdstr-val nonce = "nonce" "=" "nonce-value " nonce-value = qdstr-val qop-options = "qop" "=" " qop-list " qop-list = 1#qop-value qop-value = "auth" | "auth-int" | "auth-conf" | token stale = "stale" "=" "true" maxbuf = "maxbuf" "=" maxbuf-value maxbuf-value = 1*DIGIT charset = "charset" "=" "utf-8" algorithm = "algorithm" "=" "md5-sess" cipher-opts = "cipher" "=" "1#cipher-value" cipher-value = "3des" | "des" | "rc4-40" | "rc4" | "rc4-56" | token auth-param = token "=" ( token | quoted-string )

member.name: F:Rebex.Security.Cryptography.CryptMD5Digest._digestData
member.summary: Array after parsing digest challenge from server.

member.name: F:Rebex.Security.Cryptography.CryptMD5Digest._service
member.summary: Digest-uri value imap/servername.com.

member.name: F:Rebex.Security.Cryptography.CryptMD5Digest._cnonce_value
member.summary: Client string unique for each response.

member.name: F:Rebex.Security.Cryptography.CryptMD5Digest._server_response
member.summary: Response value from server after send client authentication string.

member.name: F:Rebex.Security.Cryptography.CryptMD5Digest._qopLevel
member.summary: Ordering for the "quality of protection" tokens (server presents a list, client selects the best from it).
member.remarks: Maps string to int.

member.name: M:Rebex.Security.Cryptography.CryptMD5Digest.DigestMD5(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Create Digest-MD5 hash string.
member.param: User name.
Password.
member.returns: Digest-MD5 hash string.

member.name: M:Rebex.Security.Cryptography.CryptMD5Digest.GetQop
member.summary: Selects the best "quality of protection" from the list sent by server.
member.returns: One of "", "auth", "auth-int" or "auth-conf".

member.name: M:Rebex.Security.Cryptography.CryptMD5Digest.DigestResponse(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Create digest response string.
member.param: User name to server.
Password to server.

member.name: M:Rebex.Security.Cryptography.CryptMD5Digest.GetEncodedClientData(System.String)
member.summary: Username and password encoding, as specified by RFC 2831: Even if "charset=UTF-8" is present, if all the characters are in the ISO 8859-1 character set, then the value must be converted to ISO 8859-1 before being hashed.

member.name: M:Rebex.Security.Cryptography.CryptMD5Digest.CompareResponse(System.String)
member.summary: Compare computing client digest-value and value from the server.
member.param: BASE64 encoding string digest-response from the server.
member.returns: True if response from server equals the response string generated by client.

member.name: M:Rebex.Security.Cryptography.CryptMD5Digest.DigestValue(System.String)
member.summary: Return digest val from values sent from server.
member.param: digest property.
member.returns: Value of digest property.

member.name: M:Rebex.Security.Cryptography.CryptMD5Digest.ToWide(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Casts bytes to characters without changing their numerical values.
member.remarks: Encoding.GetString gives the same results as this method for ASCII data, but not in general (i.e. Windows 1250 converts byte 135 into character 8825).

member.name: T:Rebex.Security.Cryptography.MD5DigestExceptionCause
member.summary: The ways DIGEST-MD5 can fail (currently just one).

member.name: F:Rebex.Security.Cryptography.MD5DigestExceptionCause.InsufficientEncoding
member.summary: Authentication data doesn't fit into Latin 1, but server doesn't support any other charset.

member.name: F:Rebex.Security.Cryptography.MD5DigestExceptionCause.NoQopValueRecognized
member.summary: Server offers no recognizable quality of protection values.

member.summary: Creates a cryptographic object to compute the MD4 hash.

member.name: T:Rebex.Net.RebexAsyncResult
member.summary: Universal class for asynchronous method invocation.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.RebexAsyncResult.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Dispose(bool disposing) executes in two distinct scenarios. If disposing equals true, the method has been called directly or indirectly by a user's code. Managed and unmanaged resources can be disposed. If disposing equals false, the method has been called by the runtime from inside the finalizer and you should not reference other objects. Only unmanaged resources can be disposed.
member.param: If true, is called by IDisposable.Dispose. Otherwise it is called by finalizer.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.RebexAsyncResult.Dispose
member.summary: Implementation of IDisposable.Dispose()

member.summary: Find the ThreadInfo instance that corresponds to the thread

member.summary: Find a free thread

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.Abort
member.summary: Aborts the current operation.

remarks.p: The aborted operation will end either successfully, or with of status OperationAborted or Timeout. The object may remain in Reading, Sending or Processing state. In this case, the object is not usable any more and a call to is recommended.

member.returns: The welcome message returned by the server.

member.summary: Secures the connection with TLS/SSL using the specified parameters.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.Secure
member.summary: Secures the connection with TLS/SSL using default parameters.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.Send(Rebex.Mime.MimeMessage,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sends a mail message ().
member.param: The message.
Message sender address.
The list of recipients.
member.remarks: If the sender argument address is not specified, it is taken from the from the "Sender" header field or from the first address in the "From" field if the "Sender" is missing. If the recipients argument is specified, it overrides the list of recipients contained in the message. If the recipients argument is null, the list of recipients is extracted from "To", "Cc" and "Bcc" header fields. The "Bcc" field is removed from message headers prior to sending.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.Send(Rebex.Mail.MailMessage,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sends a mail message ().
member.param: The message.
Message sender address.
The list of recipients.
member.remarks: If the sender argument address is not specified, it is taken from the from the "Sender" header field or from the first address in the "From" field if the "Sender" is missing. If the recipients argument is specified, it overrides the list of recipients contained in the message. If the recipients argument is null, the list of recipients is extracted from "To", "Cc" and "Bcc" header fields. The "Bcc" field is removed from message headers prior to sending.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.Send(Rebex.Mime.MimeMessage)
member.summary: Sends a mail message ().
member.param: The message.
member.remarks: Both sender and the list of recipients are extracted from the message. The sender address is taken from the "Sender" header field or from the first address in the "From" field if the "Sender" is missing. The list of recipients comes from "To", "Cc" and "Bcc" header fields. Also, the "Bcc" field is removed from message headers prior to sending.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.Send(Rebex.Mail.MailMessage)
member.summary: Sends a mail message ().
member.param: The message.
member.remarks: Both sender and the list of recipients are extracted from the message. The sender address is taken from the "Sender" header field or from the first address in the "From" field if the "Sender" is missing. The list of recipients comes from "To", "Cc" and "Bcc" header fields. Also, the "Bcc" field is removed from message headers prior to sending.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.Send(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sends a mail message constructed from the specified parameters.
member.param: Message sender.
Comma-separated list of message recipients.
The subject of the message.
The text body of the message.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.Send(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Reads and sends a mail message from the specified stream in MIME format.
member.param: The input stream.

remarks.p: The stream must contain data in MIME format, other formats are not supported. MIME files often have the '.eml' extension and are produced by Outlook Express. In contrast, Outlook produces '.msg' files that are not MIME files and therefore cannot be sent using this method.

Both sender and the list of recipients are extracted from the message. The sender address is taken from the "Sender" header field, or from the first address in the "From" field if the "Sender" is missing. The list of recipients comes from "To", "Cc" and "Bcc" header fields. Also, the "Bcc" field is removed from message headers prior to sending.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.Send(System.String)
member.summary: Reads and sends a mail message from the specified local file in MIME format.
member.param: The path to the mail message file.

remarks.p: The file must be in MIME format, other formats are not supported. MIME files often have the '.eml' extension and are produced by Outlook Express. In contrast, Outlook produces '.msg' files that are not MIME files and therefore cannot be sent using this method.

Both sender and the list of recipients are extracted from the message. The sender address is taken from the "Sender" header field, or from the first address in the "From" field if the "Sender" is missing. The list of recipients comes from "To", "Cc" and "Bcc" header fields. Also, the "Bcc" field is removed from message headers prior to sending.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.Login(Rebex.Net.SmtpAuthentication)
member.summary: Authenticates the user to the SMTP server using the specified authentication method that does not require credentials (NTLM or GSSAPI).
member.param: Authentication method.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.Login(Rebex.Net.GssApiProvider)
member.summary: Authenticates the user to the SMTP server using the specified GSSAPI provider.
member.param: GSSAPI provider.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.Login(System.String,System.String,Rebex.Net.SmtpAuthentication)
member.summary: Authenticates the user to the SMTP server using the specified authentication method.
member.param: User name.
Password.
Authentication method.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.Verify(System.String)
member.summary: Verifies whether the server is willing to accept mail for a given recipient.
member.param: The email address of the recipient.
member.returns: The verification result.

remarks.p: Represents SMTP VRFY command.
If the server does accept mail for the recipient, the resulting will have a of 2.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.SendCommand(System.String)
member.summary: Executes a command on the SMTP server.
member.param: Command (eg. "HELP").

remarks.p: Must be followed by a call to ReadResponse method.
Use ReadResponse and SendCommand to implement various custom commands.
After a successful call to SendCommand, the object will be in Reading state.
The object must be Ready state when calling this method.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.ReadResponse
member.summary: Returns the response of the SMTP server to the command.
member.returns: Response of the SMTP server.

remarks.p: Must be preceeded by a call to SendCommand method. (Or, more exactly, the must be Reading.
Use ReadResponse and SendCommand to implement various custom commands.
After a successful call to ReadResponse, the object will be in Processing state if the response Group is 3, in Reading state if the response Group is 1 or in Ready state in other cases.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.CheckConnectionState
member.summary: Checks whether the SMTP session is still connected. Throws an exception on error.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.GetConnectionState
member.summary: Checks whether the SMTP session is still connected and returns its state.
member.returns: Connection state.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string representation of this object.
member.returns: A string representing this object

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.Login(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Authenticates the user to the SMTP server.
member.param: User name.
Password.
member.remarks: This method tries to authenticate using the following methods, in this order of preference: CRAM-MD5, DIGEST-MD5, PLAIN, LOGIN, GSSAPI, NTLM. The NTLM and GSSAPI methods are only attempted if no other method is available - please use and specify NTLM or GSSAPI directly if you wish to use them.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.KeepAlive
member.summary: Sends the NOOP command to the server to keep the connection alive.

remarks.p: Represents SMTP NOOP command.
Call this if you do not want the connection to the server to time out.
Some servers ignore NOOP command.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.Connect(System.String)
member.summary: Connects to the SMTP server.
member.param: The server address - either a hostname or a dotted string address.
member.returns: Welcome message returned by the server.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.EnhancedTurn(System.String)
member.summary: Instructs the server to start processing the message queue for a specified node (domain).
member.param: The node name, which usually corresponds to a domain name.
member.remarks: Represents SMTP ETRN command.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.SetSocketFactory(Rebex.Net.ISocketFactory)
member.summary: Sets the socket factory to be used to create communication sockets.

member.summary: Gets the list of supported authentication methods.

The server address - either a hostname or a dotted string address.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.Send(Rebex.Mail.MailMessage,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sends the message using the specified SMTP server.
member.param: Message to be sent.

SMTP server port.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.Send(System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a mail message from the specified local file in MIME format and sends it using the specified SMTP server.
member.param: The path to the mail message file.
SMTP server hostname or IP address.
SMTP server port.

remarks.p: The file must be in MIME format, other formats are not supported. MIME files often have the '.eml' extension and are produced by Outlook Express. In contrast, Outlook produces '.msg' files that are not MIME files and therefore cannot be sent using this method.

Both sender and the list of recipients are extracted from the message. The sender address is taken from the "Sender" header field, or from the first address in the "From" field if the "Sender" is missing. The list of recipients comes from "To", "Cc" and "Bcc" header fields. Also, the "Bcc" field is removed from message headers prior to sending.

member.summary: Sends a mail message constructed from the specified parameters using the specified SMTP server.
member.param: Message sender.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.ResolveDomainMX(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves the list of domain's MX records from DNS and returns the list of hosts that accept its email (in order of preference).
member.param: Mail domain to resolve.
member.returns: The list of hosts.
member.remarks: If the specified domain is an IP address, no resolving is done. Also, no resolving is done if no DNS server is available.

member.summary: Sends the message by submitting the message directly to the recipients' SMTP servers.
member.param: Message to be sent.
member.returns: The list of recipients to which the mail message failed to deliver.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.BeginDisconnect(System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Informs the server that the connection is about to close and terminates the connection.
member.param: An optional asynchronous callback to be called when the operation is complete.
A user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.
member.returns: An that references the asynchronous operation.
member.remarks: Represents SMTP QUIT command.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.EndDisconnect(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Ends a pending asynchronous disconnect operation.
member.param: Stores state information for this asynchronous operation as well as any user defined data.
member.returns: The exit message returned by the server.

member.summary: Begins a request to send a mail message ().
member.param: The message.
Message sender address.
The list of recipients.
member.remarks: If the sender argument address is not specified, it is taken from the "Sender" header field or from the first address in the "From" field if the "Sender" is missing. If the recipients argument is specified, it overrides the list of recipients contained in the message. If the recipients argument is null, the list of recipients is extracted from "To", "Cc" and "Bcc" header fields. The "Bcc" field is removed from message headers prior to sending.
member.param: An optional asynchronous callback to be called when the operation is complete.
A user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.
member.returns: An that references the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.BeginSend(Rebex.Mail.MailMessage,System.String,System.String,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins a request to send a mail message ().
member.param: The message.
Message sender address.
The list of recipients.
member.remarks: If the sender argument address is not specified, it is taken from the "Sender" header field or from the first address in the "From" field if the "Sender" is missing. If the recipients argument is specified, it overrides the list of recipients contained in the message. If the recipients argument is null, the list of recipients is extracted from "To", "Cc" and "Bcc" header fields. The "Bcc" field is removed from message headers prior to sending.
member.param: An optional asynchronous callback to be called when the operation is complete.
A user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.
member.returns: An that references the asynchronous operation.

member.summary: Begins a request to send a mail message ().
member.param: The message.
member.remarks: The sender address is extracted from the message - it is taken from the "Sender" header field, or from the first address in the "From" field if the "Sender" is missing.
member.param: An optional asynchronous callback to be called when the operation is complete.
A user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.
member.returns: An that references the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.BeginSend(Rebex.Mail.MailMessage,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins a request to send a mail message ().
member.param: The message.
member.remarks: The sender address is extracted from the message - it is taken from the "Sender" header field, or from the first address in the "From" field if the "Sender" is missing.
member.param: An optional asynchronous callback to be called when the operation is complete.
A user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.
member.returns: An that references the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.BeginSend(System.IO.Stream,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins a request to read and send a mail message from the specified stream in MIME format.
member.param: The input stream.
An optional asynchronous callback to be called when the operation is complete.
A user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.
member.returns: An that references the asynchronous operation.

remarks.p: The stream must contain data in MIME format, other formats are not supported. MIME files often have the '.eml' extension and are produced by Outlook Express. In contrast, Outlook produces '.msg' files that are not MIME files and therefore cannot be sent using this method.

Both sender and the list of recipients are extracted from the message. The sender address is taken from the "Sender" header field, or from the first address in the "From" field if the "Sender" is missing. The list of recipients comes from "To", "Cc" and "Bcc" header fields. Also, the "Bcc" field is removed from message headers prior to sending.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.BeginSend(System.String,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins a request to send read and send a mail message from the specified local file in MIME format.
member.param: The path to the mail message file.
An optional asynchronous callback to be called when the operation is complete.
A user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.
member.returns: An that references the asynchronous operation.

remarks.p: The file must be in MIME format, other formats are not supported. MIME files often have the '.eml' extension and are produced by Outlook Express. In contrast, Outlook produces '.msg' files that are not MIME files and therefore cannot be sent using this method.

Both sender and the list of recipients are extracted from the message. The sender address is taken from the "Sender" header field, or from the first address in the "From" field if the "Sender" is missing. The list of recipients comes from "To", "Cc" and "Bcc" header fields. Also, the "Bcc" field is removed from message headers prior to sending.

member.summary: Authenticates the user to the SMTP server.
member.param: The username.
Password for the given username.
Authentication method.
An optional asynchronous callback to be called when the operation is complete.
A user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.
member.returns: An that references the asynchronous operation.

remarks.p: Represents SMTP USER/PASS command pair.
For anonymous logins, use "anonymous" as a username and an email as a password.
If userName is a null reference, "anonymous" is used. If password is a null reference, "guest" is used.

A user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.

remarks.p: The BeginSendCommand/ pair must be followed by a call to ReadResponse or methods.
Use ReadResponse or BeginReadResponse and or BeginSendCommand to implement various custom commands.

member.summary: Ends a pending asynchronous command send.

member.summary: Returns the server response.
member.param: An optional asynchronous callback to be called when the operation is complete.
A user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.
member.returns: An that references the asynchronous operation.

remarks.p: Must be preceeded by a call to method or / method pair.
Use ReadResponse or BeginReadResponse and SendCommand or to implement various custom commands.

member.summary: Ends a pending asynchronous response read.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.BeginKeepAlive(System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)

member.param: An optional asynchronous callback to be called when the operation is complete.
A user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.
member.returns: An that references the asynchronous operation.

remarks.p: Represents SMTP NOOP command.
Call this if you do not want the connection to the server to time out.
Some servers ignore NOOP command.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Smtp.EndKeepAlive(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Ends a pending asynchronous NOOP command.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.Smtp.SupportedExtensions
member.summary: Gets the bit field specifying the extensions supported by the server.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.Smtp.EnabledExtensions
member.summary: Gets or sets the bit field specifying the enabled extensions.
member.remarks: Enabled extensions will be used when appropriate. By default, all extensions are enabled.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.Smtp.IsSecured
member.summary: Gets the value indicating whether the control connection is secured.
member.value: True if secure, false if not secure.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.Smtp.TlsSocket
member.summary: Returns the TLS/SSL socket of secured control connection.
member.returns: The TLS/SSL socket of secured control connection, or null if the connection is not secured.
member.remarks: This property is intended for advanced users only. class does not expect the socket to be altered in any way.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.Smtp.Timeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the length of time before the operation times out (specify -1 or 0 to indicate that the request does not time out).
member.value: The length of time, in milliseconds, until the operation times out, or the value -1 or 0 to indicate that the request does not time out. Default is 60000 (60 seconds).

remarks.p: The internal timeout counter is reset every time data is sent or received from to server.
The property affects both synchronous and asynchronous methods.
Minimal value is 1000. Setting this to a value lower than 1000 will set it to 1000.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.Smtp.AbortTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the length of time before the abort operation times out.
member.value: The length of time, in milliseconds, until the abort operation times out. Default is 3000, which seems to be a reasonable value.
member.remarks: Minimal value is 1000. Setting this to a value lower than 1000 will set it to 1000.

member.name: T:Rebex.Net.SmtpExceptionStatus
member.summary: Defines status codes for the class.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SmtpExceptionStatus.ConnectFailure
member.summary: The remote service point could not be contacted at the transport level.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SmtpExceptionStatus.ConnectionClosed
member.summary: The connection was prematurely closed.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SmtpExceptionStatus.SocketError
member.summary: The error at transport level occured.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SmtpExceptionStatus.NameResolutionFailure
member.summary: The name resolver service could not resolve the host name.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SmtpExceptionStatus.Pending
member.summary: An operation is pending.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SmtpExceptionStatus.ProtocolError
member.summary: The response received from the server was complete but indicated a protocol-level error. For example, an SMTP protocol error such as '550 Unable to relay' would use this status.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SmtpExceptionStatus.ProxyNameResolutionFailure
member.summary: The name resolver service could not resolve the proxy host name.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SmtpExceptionStatus.ReceiveFailure
member.summary: A complete response was not received from the remote server.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SmtpExceptionStatus.OperationAborted
member.summary: The operation was aborted by a call to the method.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SmtpExceptionStatus.UnclassifiableError
member.summary: An unclassifiable error occurred. This is the default value for .

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SmtpExceptionStatus.SendFailure
member.summary: A complete request could not be sent to the remote server.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SmtpExceptionStatus.ServerProtocolViolation
member.summary: The server response was not a valid SMTP response.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SmtpExceptionStatus.Timeout
member.summary: No response was received during the time-out period for a request.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SmtpExceptionStatus.AsyncError
member.summary: General exception in asynchronous call.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SmtpExceptionStatus.OperationFailure
member.summary: The requested operation could not be completed.

member.name: T:Rebex.Net.SmtpException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when an error occurs while using Smtp component.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.SmtpException.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.remarks: This constructor initializes the Message property of the new instance to a message that describes the general error.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.SmtpException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified error message.
member.param: The message that describes the error.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.SmtpException.#ctor(System.String,Rebex.Net.SmtpExceptionStatus)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified error message and status.
member.param: The message that describes the error.
One of the values.
member.remarks: The status must not be ProtocolError. Use SmtpException (SmtpResponse response) constructor for creating protocol error exceptions.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.SmtpException.#ctor(System.String,Rebex.Net.SmtpExceptionStatus,Rebex.Net.SmtpRejectedRecipient[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified error message, status, and a list of rejected recipients.
member.param: The message that describes the error.
One of the values.
A list of rejected recipients.
member.remarks: The status must not be ProtocolError. Use SmtpException (SmtpResponse response) constructor for creating protocol error exceptions.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.SmtpException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
member.param: The message that describes the error.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception. If the innerException parameter is not a null reference, the current exception is raised in a catch block that handles the inner exception.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.SmtpException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception,Rebex.Net.SmtpExceptionStatus)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified error message, status, and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
member.param: The message that describes the error.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception. If the innerException parameter is not a null reference, the current exception is raised in a catch block that handles the inner exception.
One of the values.
member.remarks: The status must not be ProtocolError. Use SmtpException (SmtpResponse response) constructor for creating protocol error exceptions.

member.summary: Gets the if the exception.

member.name: T:Rebex.Net.SmtpOptions

member.summary: No options.

member.summary: Allow null sender (<>) to be used.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SmtpOptions.SendWithNoBuffer
member.summary: Causes the and methods to send message data directly from the input file or stream.

member.name: T:Rebex.Net.SmtpSecurity
member.summary: Specifies the SMTP connection security.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SmtpSecurity.Unsecure
member.summary: Initially unsecured connection.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SmtpSecurity.Implicit
member.summary: Implicitly secured connection.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SmtpSecurity.Explicit
member.summary: Explicitly secured connection. Same as Secure.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SmtpSecurity.Secure
member.summary: Explicitly secured connection. Same as Explicit.

member.summary: Pipelining.

member.summary: Choose automatically.

member.summary: NTLM authentication.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SmtpAuthentication.GssApi
member.summary: GSSAPI/SSPI authentication (only Kerberos, NTLM and Negotiate (SPNEGO) are currently supported).

member.name: T:Rebex.Net.DeliveryStatusNotificationConditions
member.summary: Specifies the conditions under which the SMTP server should generate and send DSN messages.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.DeliveryStatusNotificationConditions.None
member.summary: Never generate DSN.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.DeliveryStatusNotificationConditions.Success
member.summary: Generate DSN on successful delivery.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.DeliveryStatusNotificationConditions.Failure
member.summary: Generate DSN on delivery failure.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.DeliveryStatusNotificationConditions.Delay
member.summary: Generate DSN if delivery of a message has been delayed for an unusual amount of time.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.DeliveryStatusNotificationConditions.All
member.summary: All conditions.

member.name: T:Rebex.Net.DeliveryStatusNotificationOriginalMessageMethod
member.summary: Specifies whether a SMTP server should attach the entire original message or its headers only to DSN messages.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.DeliveryStatusNotificationOriginalMessageMethod.Default
member.summary: Let the SMTP use its default behavior of including the original message in a DSN message.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.DeliveryStatusNotificationOriginalMessageMethod.FullMessage
member.summary: Include the full original message in a DSN message.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.DeliveryStatusNotificationOriginalMessageMethod.HeadersOnly
member.summary: Only include original message headers in a DSN message.

member.name: T:Rebex.Net.SmtpResponse

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified code, description and raw response string.
member.param: The SMTP response code. Must be in range of 100 to 599.
The description of the response code.
Raw SMTP response.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.SmtpResponse.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified code, enhanced code, description and raw response string.
member.param: The SMTP response code. Must be in range of 100 to 599.
The SMTP enhanced response code subject. Must be in range of 1 to 999.
The SMTP enhanced response code detail. Must be in range of 1 to 999.
The description of the response code.
Raw SMTP response.

member.summary: Gets the full unparsed response of the SMTP server.

member.summary: Gets the group of the SMTP response code.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.SmtpResponse.Success
member.summary: Returns true when last command was completed successfully.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.SmtpResponse.Class
